decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing control elements and disruptive spells to maintain board control and outmaneuver opponents. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and disruptive permanents to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining card advantage and building towards combo finishes. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion, providing a more resourceful playstyle. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game, limit the opponent's options, and ultimately secure victory through superior strategic planning and efficient use of resources.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy using counterspells and removal spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. It also utilizes card draw and selection with cards like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time to dig for essential pieces. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent card advantage and recursion of key threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up resources to eventually overwhelm them with efficient threats and card advantage.

The deck aims to utilize the artifact heavy mana base to generate large amounts of mana quickly, creating the opportunity to cast powerful spells such as Paradoxical Outcome. By bouncing a large number of artifacts back to hand, the player can draw significant portions of their deck and generate even more mana, potentially leading to a game-winning play. The inclusion of cantrips, counterspells, and disruption spells helps protect the combo and ensure the player's ability to execute their game plan effectively and efficiently.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently with artifacts like Moxen and Mana Crypt, while also using cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and replay those artifacts to generate even more mana. The deck aims to set up a big turn where it can play multiple spells in a single turn, eventually leading to a game-winning combo or overwhelming advantage. The deck also includes disruption and protection spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its game plan and ensure it can execute its combo without interference.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient spells, disruptive creatures, and powerful artifact mana to gain tempo and control the game. By combining aggressive early plays with disruptive elements like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as key removal spells like Fatal Push, the deck aims to outpace and disrupt the opponent while generating card advantage through cantrips and powerful draw spells like Dig Through Time and Ancestral Recall. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional recursion and value to the deck.

The deck focuses on efficiently controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and resource denial. It utilizes powerful control cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt opponents while generating value through cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recurring cheap permanents. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents by carefully managing resources and disrupting their game plan until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on combining multiple artifacts, including the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo, to generate a huge amount of mana and draw cards with Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by casting multiple spells in a single turn, utilizing cards like Tezzeret, Yawgmoth's Will, and Bolas's Citadel. The deck aims to control the game with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Karn, the Great Creator, while being able to tutor for key combo pieces with cards like Demonic Tutor and Merchant Scroll.

This deck utilizes the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach to repeatedly recur spells from the graveyard, enabling a fast and efficient win condition. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Lotus Petal to be played from the graveyard. The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, while also digging through the deck quickly with cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive, disrupt opponents' strategies, and quickly assemble its combo pieces for a decisive win.
